Hey folks! I'm splitting out this thread to specifically discuss the background color changes proposed in #design > UI redesign .

In particular, Vlad Korobov 's most recent prototype makes the following changes in light mode:

  1. Changes the overall background color to a light-ish grey, with the message feed cards keeping their white background. This creates more visual separation between the sidebars and the message feed, and also between sections in the message feed.
  2. Changes the color of a selected section in the left sidebar (e.g. stream or PMs) to white. There's bunch of specifics regarding selections that we should discuss, which I'll call out in a follow-up message.
  3. Makes the background for unread counts lighter than at present (but still a bit darker than the background grey color), and changes the font from white to black.
  4. Changes the background for the compose area to a light grey (lighter than the sidebars, matching the proposed nav bar color), both when collapsed and when expanded. (We can think about whether this change can be made later.)

I assume we would want to make a parallel set of changes in dark mode, but I think it's fine to keep the discussion focused on light mode for now.

07-01-styles-update-no-new-features.png

In terms of selection highlighting, unless I missed something, we currently have:

  1. Blue background for selected stream/PMs. Design prototype changes this to white.

  2. Blue background and bold font for selected topic or PM conversation. Vlad Korobov has prototyped two options (posted in #design > UI redesign: selected topic ).
    current-selected
    proposed-selected-1.png
    proposed-selected-2.png

  3. Green-ish grey hover color in the left and right sidebars. I'm not sure if we have a proposal for this one.

I think we can probably leave highlighting for @-mentioned messages and the blue selection box out of this thread, and discuss them separately.

We also currently have text fading behavior in the right sidebar, but it should be removed when #20072 is merged.

Did I miss any others?

Green-ish grey hover color in the left and right sidebars. I'm not sure if we have a proposal for this one.

current-hover

I love the change to a light gray neutral background color, and a white background for the cards.
I think we reconsider the :hover and :active colors to a more neutral setup as well.

So a white opacity or dark opacity change rather than including the blue. Reasoning:
• ensure there is a distinct value change (light blue hover next to light gray background can carry too similar of a color value contrast)
• does not clash with or contradict stream color and stream color hashtag graphic
• allows other color states to have increased hierarchy (links, marker, streams)
• perhaps simplifies the layout further by reducing color noise

So let's focus on grey vs light blue background dilemma. And lets put hover state aside for now, since its possible to live without hover highlights :)

Having a base grey background we have 2 options of another grey to highlight an active section: darker or lighter.
Suggested base background grey is very light, so lighter is actually white. Darker is a possibility, but anything darker than the suggested background damages readability of a colored hashtag. Example: image.png
In your version is ok because you showing red hashtag icon which is very contrasty: image.png

I hope we agree that selection color couldn't be darker grey for the light theme: image.png

Now if the section selection is white should we use a grey for another level of selection? I think NO. Because it is confusing, since the background is grey. Also we have blue focus ring, which is kind of selection and its nice to be consistent.
Yes, I think the white looks much better than the grey for the large selected area (topics in a selected stream), and it makes sense to me to have the other selections be white to match.

blue on white is contrasty enough: image.png
but you right that there is a challenge with blue on grey.
But in action when you move your mouse its pretty detectable: image.png

I like having hover lighter than actual selection because when you click the thing isn't blinking. Yes we could tune the blue to be more vibrant on hover but its a very minor thing, easily changeable without people noticing.

Yes for sure not gray for the entire selection color :)
I agree that the a challenge with a lighter hover, as we will have fully white background areas that would require a different hover approach.
So simplifying with either a single change in color (blue) or a value (gray) both seem viable to me.
Andy, are you agains suggested blue for highlighting the selection?

I think it looks good. There is some disconnect with the Stream selection being white and the Topic selection being blue. It's a tricky piece of UI.
I do prefer though keeping the hover neutral in color similar to the Discord and Slack setups.

Light blue backing for the Marker color also has some challenges with all the variable content that can be included inside. Particularly blue linking.
Also the consideration that this Marker shares styling with our :focus state, so it would be used in many instances.
These detail thoughts should be considered separately from the general background changes which look fantastic.
